content: practice sampler cowl b� olg�olac� you ve learned to cast on knit and purl now it s time to practice the stitches you ve learned and expand your skills by learning to read a written pattern this pattern uses only simple knit and purl sts to create a variety of textures that will help you begin to learn to read your knitting as well if you wish to have a longer cowl that can be worn looped twice around the neck you can make each of the pattern sections longer or repeat the entire sequence 2 or 3 times until desired length i recommend a final abbreviations circumference of 46-48 inches for a warm and rs right side snug double looped cowl individual preference ws wrong side may vary st stitch you may also opt to make a scarf in which case stst stst stockinette stitch knit on rs purl on i recommend a length of 60-72 inches again ws depending on individual preference k knit remember if making a longer cowl or scarf p purl more yarn will be required m marker pm place marker materials one 100 gram skein of worsted sm slip marker weight yarn approximately 220 yards per 100 yo yarn over grams sample used 1 skein of berroco k2tog knit 2 sts together vintage the sample cowl used 70 grams or k p k knit 1 purl 1 knit 1 this sequence is approximately 160 yards repeated at the beginning and end of every row to create a seed stitch border that looks nice us size 8 5mm needles straight or 24 and doesn t curl circulars to knit back and forth or size needed to obtain gauge 2 stitch markers darning needle gauge 18 sts and 24 row over 4 inches in stst washed and blocked differences in gauge may alter yardage requirements finished size 9 inches wide by 22 inches long © olga olach 1 directions sectione simplecheck caston42stsusinganymethod row1 k p k sm ktom sm k p k
